project.teaser: SHIELD4CROWD focuses on enhancing the protection of public spaces in EU cities against security threats related to crowd management. Public spaces are indeed largely exposed to several threats like UAV and UGV attacks, CBRN attacks, cold weapons/ firearms attacks or urban...
project.objective:
SHIELD4CROWD focuses on enhancing the protection of public spaces in EU cities against security threats related to crowd management. Public spaces are indeed largely exposed to several threats like UAV and UGV attacks, CBRN attacks, cold weapons/ firearms attacks or urban riots, and gatherings are by themselves a potential target for terrorist or criminal attacks.
This focus is shared, from the start, by several actors and specifically by security practitioners. 3 ministries of Interior from 3 EU countries, 1 Public Transport Operator and 2 security practitioners from Poland and Slovakia are thus involved as full partners. Many other end-users will also be involved through the User Observatory Group (UOG) and some of them have already expressed official interest for the project.
SHIELD4CROWD implements a progressive and iterative process to jointly define one common challenge that can be tackled with identified candidate technology serving the basis for future PCP, for which the buyers group will be created during the project, through the continuous involvement of the UOG. First, 10 jointly defined Common Security Use Cases will fully describe the gaps between available solutions, existing processes and identified needs. A technological analysis of those needs will then be conducted by technological experts, including exploration of legal, societal, ethical, and environmental considerations, to allow the end users to converge to 3 uses cases, from which a SOTA analysis and 4 Open Market Consultations will be conducted. All the results will finally serve to the definition of the common challenge and the elaboration of the first set of Tender Documentation.
SHIELD4CROWD includes a Security Advisory Board to manage the sensitive knowledge generated by its activities, and several advisors to guide the elaboration of a Common Challenge fully compliant with Europes privacy and data protection regulations.
project.title: Setting baseline for a PCP Heightening Innovation Procurements in the European security ecosystem and Leveraging synergies through Dissemination activities for CROWD management
project.keywords: Public Sector Innovation, Demand Driven Innovation, Security Threats and Vulnerabilities, Crowd management

article.title: Addressing varied threats to public spaces

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

article.title: Future innovative solutions to increase crowd management security in EU public spaces
article.teaser: The EU-funded SHIELD4CROWD project identified key security threats in public spaces, paving the way for future advancements in crowd management and safety.

category.title: Topic

result.title: Report on requirements based on these technologies (ethical aspects, social and legal constraints)
result.description: The deliverable will consist of an extensive screening of all the requirements the solutions may bring in terms of social acceptability, legal constraints, environmental impacts, and interoperability impacts. The report will also include details on the measures to implement to mitigate any related risks that may emerge.

result.title: Training kit, program & information flyer
result.description: This deliverable contains the full information used during the training days. Moreover, this deliverable will include the definition of the training program information kit, promoted through WP2 and WP6, the detailed planning, the registration information and the terms and conditions. The flyer will be prepared for electronic distribution and will not be printed.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SHIELD4CROWD (Setting baseline for a PCP Heightening Innovation Procurements in the European security ecosystem and Leveraging synergies through Dissemination activities for CROWD management)
result.teaser: The SHIELD4CROWD project focuses on enhancing the protection of public spaces in European Union cities against a variety of security threats associated with crowd management. Public spaces are particularly vulnerable to numerous risks, including UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicles)...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report on procurement preparation activities
result.description: This deliverable contains a summary of the OMC and e-Pitching sessions results, the Business case and the procurement strategy.

result.title: SHIELD4CROWD UOG Final report
result.description: This report consolidates the lessons learnt from operating the UOG, it will report on the meetings held during the project, as well as on the intermediate online interactions.

result.title: Final exploitation, IPR and uptake mechanisms
result.description: This deliverable will contain a detailed market analysis of relevant target markets, the identification of Key Exploitable assets, and proposed business models and plans for exploitation and long-term sustainability.

result.title: Motion design video presenting the common challenge
result.description: A motion design video describing the iterative achievements of WP3 and WP4 to enhance the common challenge.

result.title: Mapping/catalogue of technologies & SOTA Analysis
result.description: This deliverable will consist of a mapping of both COTS technologies and innovative technologies in low TRL that would permit to tackle the identified gaps, including the results of the SOTA analysis and proposing a catalogue of the technologies. The report will clearly identify the technological gap that the future PCP will cover.

result.title: Report on SHIELD4CROWD Dissemination and Communication
result.description: This deliverable will present the final report on the undertaken dissemination, communication, and collaboration activities, as well as on the project’s interactions with the community of stakeholders.

result.title: Initial Market Analysis, Business Model and IPR
result.description: This deliverable will contain a preliminary market analysis, propose business models and setup of IPR register.

result.title: Identity kit, Online presence and Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: The document provides the first issue of the overall dissemination and communication plan of the project. It sets out all planned dissemination and awareness activities, the target groups, the content, the dissemination channels. It will also content the project identity kit and prepared templates of working documents.

result.title: SHIELD4CROWD Project Guidelines & collaboration governance model
result.description: Reference guidelines for project partners for all activities of the project in terms of coordination, quality, security, confidentiality, online platform, internal mailings, external communication approval process, etc.

result.title: UOG Membership Handbook
result.description: Report providing the interested practitioners with all the information they need to join the UOG. It also includes the strategy for community building and outreach.

result.title: SHIELD4CROWD GPB Structure and roles
result.description: This deliverable will describe the roles and structure of the GPB, it will report on the work of the group and include the future mechanisms for SHIELD4CROWD community operations beyond the end of the project. It will also identify the Lead Procurer and ensure the commitment of Public Buyers through letters of intent.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
